page.syntax: Future_Value as N = FV(N investments,N Interest_rate,N time_periods)

argument.name: investments
argument.description: Numeric. Amount of each equal investment.

argument.name: Interest_rate
argument.description: Numeric. Interest rate per time period.

argument.name: time_periods
argument.description: Numeric. Number of time periods (and investments).

page.description: Returns the future value of a stream of equal investments over a specified integer term.
page.discussion: FV() returns the future value of a stream of equal Investments, invested at a fixed Interest_Rate for a certain Number_Of_Time_Periods. The investment amount can be either positive or negative; however, the Interest_Rate and Number_Of_Time_Periods must be positive. You use this function to find the amount that an investment will be worth (sum of all principal payments plus accumulated interest) at some future point.
